definitions: point in sky directly overhead or highest point reached by celestial body
examples: The sun reached its zenith at noon today
Her career was at its zenith during the nineties

definitions: soft gentle breeze especially from the west
examples: A cool zephyr rustled through the garden leaves
The zephyr brought relief from the afternoon heat

definitions: large rigid airship with internal metal framework covered with fabric
examples: The zeppelin floated majestically over the city skyline
Passengers boarded the zeppelin for their transatlantic journey

definitions: numerical symbol representing no quantity or null value
point on scale from which positive or negative quantities are measured
examples: The temperature dropped below zero last night
She scored zero points in the first round
We need to return to zero before starting over
The scale was calibrated to zero before weighing

definitions: great enthusiasm and energy for experiencing life or activities
outer colored part of citrus fruit peel used for flavoring
examples: She approached every challenge with remarkable zest
His zest for adventure never seemed to fade
Add lemon zest to brighten the flavor
The recipe calls for orange zest and juice

definitions: sixth letter of the Greek alphabet
examples: The mathematician used zeta to represent the variable
Zeta follows epsilon in the Greek alphabet

definitions: sharp change in direction forming angle in path or line
examples: The path made a sudden zig to the left
He drew a zig before continuing the pattern

definitions: ancient Mesopotamian temple tower with successive stories each smaller than below
examples: The ancient ziggurat dominated the city's skyline
Archaeologists uncovered remains of a massive ziggurat

definitions: pattern or path with sharp alternating left and right turns
examples: The lightning created a zigzag across the sky
She sewed a decorative zigzag along the hem

definitions: bluish-white metallic element used in alloys and galvanizing
examples: The roof was covered with zinc sheeting
Zinc supplements can help boost your immune system

definitions: variety of red wine grape grown especially in California
examples: They ordered a bottle of zinfandel with dinner
The vineyard specializes in growing old vine zinfandel

definitions: sharp high-pitched humming or ringing sound
quality of being exciting lively or stimulating
examples: The arrow made a zing as it flew by
We heard the zing of bullets overhead
Her presentation really had some zing to it
This sauce needs more zing from extra spices

definitions: fastening device with interlocking metal or plastic teeth
energy vitality or brisk movement
nothing zero or nil amount
examples: The zip on my jacket got stuck again
She pulled the zip all the way up
He moved with remarkable zip for his age
Add some zip to your presentation style
We got zip from our efforts yesterday
The score remained zip throughout the first half

definitions: device with two rows of interlocking teeth for fastening openings
examples: The zipper on her backpack broke yesterday
He carefully pulled the zipper over the sleeping bag

definitions: brand of refillable metal cigarette lighter with hinged lid
examples: His grandfather's old zippo still worked perfectly
The soldier carried a zippo throughout the war

definitions: hard lustrous mineral used as gemstone and source of zirconium
examples: The ring featured a brilliant blue zircon
Zircon crystals can be millions of years old

definitions: white crystalline oxide of zirconium used in ceramics and jewelry
examples: The dental crown was made from zirconia
Cubic zirconia resembles diamonds but costs much less

definitions: musical instrument with many strings stretched over flat soundboard
examples: She played a haunting melody on the zither
The zither produces a distinctive ethereal sound

definitions: imaginary belt in sky containing paths of sun moon and planets divided into twelve signs
examples: Her zodiac sign is Scorpio
Ancient astronomers mapped the constellations of the zodiac

definitions: reanimated dead person in horror fiction and folklore
person who appears lifeless exhausted or lacking independent thought
examples: The movie featured zombies attacking the survivors
They barricaded themselves against the zombie horde
After the all-nighter she felt like a zombie
He wandered around like a zombie before coffee

definitions: legal mechanism to regulate land use within municipality by dividing into zones
examples: The zoning laws prohibit commercial buildings here
They applied for zoning variance to build apartments

definitions: facility where wild animals are kept for public exhibition conservation and study
examples: The children enjoyed their trip to the zoo
The zoo has a successful breeding program for pandas

definitions: scientist who studies animals their behavior physiology classification and distribution
examples: The zoologist spent years studying primate behavior
She became a zoologist to help protect endangered species

definitions: scientific study of animals including their structure physiology development and classification
examples: He earned his doctorate in zoology from Oxford
Zoology encompasses everything from insects to mammals

definitions: move or travel very quickly with buzzing or humming sound
change focal length of camera lens to magnify or reduce image
examples: The motorcycle zoomed past us on the highway
Birds zoomed overhead chasing insects
She used zoom to get closer shots of wildlife
The camera can zoom in for detailed views

definitions: cylindrical green summer squash vegetable harvested while immature
examples: She grated fresh zucchini for the bread recipe
The garden produced enormous zucchini this year

definitions: form of American folk music from southwest Louisiana blending blues rhythm and blues with indigenous music
examples: The festival featured authentic zydeco bands from Louisiana
They danced all night to the zydeco music

definitions: cell formed by union of male and female gametes before embryonic development
examples: The zygote begins dividing shortly after fertilization
A human zygote contains genetic material from both parents

definitions: native or inhabitant of Malawi a landlocked country in southeastern Africa
examples: The Malawian athlete won gold at the games
Many Malawians work in agriculture and fishing

definitions: member of people inhabiting Malaysia and nearby regions
Austronesian language spoken in Malaysia Indonesia and nearby areas
examples: The Malay community celebrates Hari Raya Aidilfitri
Traditional Malay cuisine features rice and spices
She studied Malay to communicate with local residents
Malay serves as lingua franca in the region

definitions: Dravidian language spoken mainly in Kerala state of southwestern India
examples: Malayalam cinema produces critically acclaimed films
She learned Malayalam from her grandmother

definitions: person or thing from former Federation of Malaya in Southeast Asia
examples: The Malayan tiger is critically endangered
Malayan history includes diverse cultural influences

definitions: native or inhabitant of Malaysia a Southeast Asian country
examples: The Malaysian chef opened a restaurant downtown
Malaysian culture blends Malay Chinese and Indian influences

definitions: native or inhabitant of Maldives an island nation in Indian Ocean
examples: The Maldivian guide showed us the coral reefs
Maldivian cuisine features fresh seafood and coconut

definitions: native or inhabitant of Mali a landlocked country in West Africa
examples: The Malian musician played traditional instruments
Many Malians speak French as second language

definitions: native or inhabitant of Malta an island nation in Mediterranean
small white toy dog breed with long silky coat
examples: The Maltese artist displayed work at the gallery
Maltese history spans thousands of years
Her Maltese won best in show at the competition
The Maltese requires regular grooming

definitions: person who believes population growth will outpace food supply causing catastrophe
examples: Malthusian economists warned about resource depletion
The Malthusian perspective influenced population policies

definitions: informal word for mother used especially in Wales and Ireland
examples: The child called out for his mam
Mam always made the best Sunday roast

definitions: informal Spanish term for mother or attractive woman
examples: The toddler reached for his mami
She called her mami every Sunday morning

definitions: member of people who conquered China establishing Qing dynasty
Tungusic language of Manchu people now nearly extinct
examples: The Manchu ruled China for over 250 years
Traditional Manchu clothing influenced Chinese fashion
Few people still speak Manchu fluently today
Scholars work to preserve Manchu language documents

definitions: standard form of Chinese based on Beijing dialect
high-ranking government official especially in imperial China
small sweet orange with loose easily peeled skin
examples: She studied Mandarin for business communication
Mandarin is spoken by over billion people
The mandarin wielded considerable power at court
Mandarins administered the imperial examination system
Fresh mandarins make a healthy winter snack
The mandarin tree produced abundant fruit

definitions: habitual gesture way of speaking or behavior peculiar to individual
European art style of 16th century characterized by elongation and distortion
examples: His constant throat clearing was an annoying mannerism
She adopted several mannerisms from her mentor
Mannerism bridged Renaissance and Baroque art periods
The painting showed typical mannerism elongated figures

definitions: loose sleeveless cloak worn over other garments
layer of Earth between crust and core
important role or responsibility passed from one person to another
examples: She wrapped the velvet mantle around her shoulders
The wizard wore a star-covered mantle
The mantle comprises most of Earth's volume
Mantle rock sometimes reaches the surface through volcanoes
He assumed the mantle of leadership reluctantly
She inherited the mantle from her predecessor

definitions: relating to Isle of Man its people or Celtic language
breed of domestic cat having no tail or very short tail
examples: The Manx language is experiencing a revival
Manx folklore includes many Celtic legends
Their Manx cat was playful despite lacking a tail
The Manx breed originated on Isle of Man

definitions: communist ideology developed by Mao Zedong emphasizing peasant revolution and continuous class struggle
examples: Maoism influenced revolutionary movements worldwide
Students debated the principles of Maoism

definitions: person who follows or supports the communist ideology of Mao Zedong
examples: The Maoist rebels controlled rural territories
Former Maoists now participate in democratic politics

definitions: member of indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
examples: The Maori performed a traditional haka dance
Maori culture plays vital role in New Zealand identity

definitions: third month of year in Gregorian calendar between February and April
examples: Spring officially begins in March
They planned their wedding for next March

definitions: Indo-Aryan language spoken mainly in Maharashtra state of western India
examples: Marathi literature has a rich thousand-year history
She writes poetry in both Marathi and English
